name: Netherlands
notes: Very English-friendly. 30% tax ruling for expats. Strong tech scene (Amsterdam, Eindhoven). Good work-life balance. EU access.

visa_types.name: Highly Skilled Migrant Visa (Kennismigrant)
visa_types.description: For skilled workers. Employer must be recognized sponsor.
visa_types.path_to_pr: 5 years residence → PR or faster via integration
visa_types.spouse_work_rights: Full work rights (no separate permit needed)
tips: 30% tax ruling: 30% of salary tax-free for 5 years
Most tech companies are recognized sponsors

visa_types.name: EU Blue Card (Netherlands)
visa_types.description: EU-wide work permit for highly qualified workers.
requirements: Employment contract for at least 1 year
visa_types.path_to_pr: Can move within EU after 18 months
tips: Most tech workers use Kennismigrant instead

visa_types.name: Startup Visa
visa_types.description: For entrepreneurs starting innovative businesses with a facilitator.
visa_types.path_to_pr: Convert to self-employed visa after 1 year

visa_types.name: Orientation Year (Zoekjaar)
visa_types.description: 1-year visa to search for work after graduating from Dutch or top-ranked foreign university.
requirements: Graduated from Dutch university within 3 years OR
Graduated from top 200 university (foreign) within 3 years
tips: Can work any job during orientation year
Good for job hunting in NL
